column8: Salary on Scale - Not Role Dependent

Salary: Yearly salary is divided by 13 and paid monthly, with the June/December each receiving 1.5 months salary. USD600 is transferred to local peso account each month (by law); remaining sent to the account of your choosing.
Housing: Provided or Allowance. Faculty typically pay $100-200 per month out of pocket for utilities/currency fluctuations. Paid in local currency to a local account. Cannot be converted to dollars.
Flights: Round-trip once per year or cash allowance based on home of record. One-way end of contract (No cash-out option)
Retirement: 8% employer match
Settling Allowance: Generous cash allowance - varies by number of dependents.
Exit Allowance: Shipping paid against receipts. No cash or severance.
Other: Home internet provided + $100 COLA paid in local currency. Faculty children receive tuition. Free school lunch.
Savings: $10000-$20000 for a single. Couples typically live off of one salary and save the other. A VERY frugal person can live entirely off of their peso deposit and save their entire dollar salary.
*Benefits/allowances are regularly adjusted - for better or worse*

Housing is in pesos (I converted it to USD). Most pay out of pocket. 8% retirement match. Local health plan. Worldwide health plan. A very small COLA. Home Internet Is paid. Free lunch. This is the expat package. The local one is very low in pesos and leads to tension between groups. Paid for unused sick days.
4000 euros settling in allowance. Generous PD fund. 400 euros to go toward learning German. (Monthly salary figure is after tax.)

column16: Variable with no apparent fixed percentage and no clear explanation - typical for Japan, not unique to this school.
column20: ALL BENEFITS other than flights and scholarship are taxed. The actual tax amount is not clear a clear percentage and varies depending on how much you earn in a given month. 'Bonus' months where you have double salary (salary is divided into 14, you are NOT getting a bonus you are just getting your salary paid in smaller chunks) are taxed at a higher rate because you have earned more money.
There is a social connection benefit for staff which can be used to do various activities within the local community. Allowance is only granted after review and approval by HR.

Child Tuition - 1 child tuition covered by school. This amount appears on your monthly salary and is taxed. The school will begin covering the cost of this tax from next year. Second child tuition partially covered by scholarship application. The amount covered can vary though roughly equates to almost 1 entire tuition fee. Scholarships are not taxed.

Additionally monthly payments from salary for local health insurance as well as local taxes. These are not benefits, they are deductions. Take home salary reduces year on year due to tax for at least the first 3 years.

The value of the Yen has a major impact on your ability to spend outside of Japan. If you have financial commitments outside Japan without additional income or substantial savings to cover it then a job anywhere in Japan is not advisable.

Housing allowance is included in the salary and taxed. Whatever is not spent is not given to the employee, the school keeps it. If you rent an apartment that only costs RM 2000 per year, the school gives you that much money even if you are entitled to a maximum housing allowance of RM 2700 per month. The school keeps the remaining RM 700.

Flight allowance: The school only pays for flights going back to and departing from the country stated in your passport or that you have stated as your residency. One flight at the end of the 2-year contract and 1 flight per additional year staying at school.

Health insurance: Inpatient is good; outpatient covers only RM 1,000 per year for single teachers (not much more for families), which is clearly insufficient. The school has just opened up a RM 2,000 fund that teachers can claim.

Children: For teachers, the school allows 2 children per teacher or per couple to study at school although some teachers have only been allowed to have 1 child enrolled at school. Teachers have to pay for the tuition of the third, fourth, etc. child.
Bupa, 3 x free child places, relocation allowance at start and end of contract, employer contributions to EPF pension scheme, interest free loan available

- If you’ve worked a full year, you get a month’s pay for each year when you leave. It’s based on your average from the last three months (initial contract is two years, with subsequent 1 year renewals).
- School provides payment for the provision of a pension scheme as set out by the Korean government.

- Teachers receive 5,000,000 KRW to settle in Busan. This allowance is paid per each household and for the initial ISB employment year only. The allowance will be paid in Korean Won upon arrival in Korea.
- The school pays a flat monthly rate for housing maintenance and utility costs. The monthly rate for a single is 220,000 KRW. The monthly rate for a couple is 275,000 KRW.
- $1,000 per year for professional development opportunities identified by the ODH staff member and approved by the school. Other mandated PD is paid for by the school.

- The school provides an annual Health and Wellness allowance. A reimbursable benefit to be used toward the employee’s (and qualified dependent’s) health and wellness, up to 1,000,000 KRW with receipts.

- Annual flight home foe employee and dependents
- Tuition fees covered for up to two children

All prices in AED (local currency) - no option for USD, EUR or GBP payments. Health insurance coverage (but very poor) - each visit to medical professional cost 50AED (payable each time outside of insurance). There is a maximum allowance which can be claimed each year. There's dental insurance only for US passport holders. Housing paid monthly - 59000AED (over 12 months) (single persons) OR 1 BR on Reem Island; or 89000 (married persons/married persons with children) OR 2 BR on Reem Island. Staff housing is not great compared to other parts of Abu Dhabi and is subject to 2 years contract meaning cannot apply for the allowance once this option is selected. One payment in first month pay of housing relocation allowance of around 1300AED. 1 child tuition allocation. School follows a teachers pay scales (company policy not to make this available to staff). There is probably an end of year gratuity (not really worth anything at the end of the contract) but this is not shown on contracts or told to staff. 1 sick day without medical note won't be deducted from salary, any more than 1 day without medical certificate of leave will be deducted from pay. 14 days total absences allowed yearly (with medical certificate), half pay 14 days with medical certificate afterwards. Absences on Fridays counts as Friday, Saturday and Sunday (3 days sickness). Stipends 700dhs per each responsibility stage.

Health insurance is poor, gratuity at end of contract is based on number of days worked on basic salary - mine is 10500. So after 4 years 28000 aed roughly. At end of contract only paid basic pay for summer And no housing allowance so not really 60 k in final year. if you have a day off booked on a mon and the following sun they will also take pay for the weekend. heads of year get 1000 aed extra.

Monthly salary stated is net. It is 3766 before income tax, health and social insurance. They also deduct at the beginning of the year your severance from YOUR salary, and you will not receive it at the end of your contract by the school as the law indicates. You will receive a reimbursement for your mandatory insurances by the government, which may or may not equate to what is owed for your severance. Housing will be 750 net next year. You can renew 'early' and get a 3k bonus, I believe, but the deadline to state your intention is stupid early (early October).
